Sentencas: In the present study a comprehensive thermodynamic model and degradation based optimization framework for energy management of anode supported solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stacks are carried out.
Titulo: Degradation based operational optimization model to improve the productivity of energy systems, case study: Solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: The optimization framework determines optimum operating conditions to maximize system productivity (energy generation over system lifetime) considering degradation mechanisms.
Titulo: Degradation based operational optimization model to improve the productivity of energy systems, case study: Solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: The main degradation mechanisms in anode supported SOFCs are nickel coarsening and oxidation.
Titulo: Degradation based operational optimization model to improve the productivity of energy systems, case study: Solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: In this study, the optimum operating conditions regarding these degradation mechanisms to achieve maximum productivity at different target lifetimes are derived.
Titulo: Degradation based operational optimization model to improve the productivity of energy systems, case study: Solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: The results show that target lifetime has a significant impact on system productivity and optimum operating temperature and current density.
Titulo: Degradation based operational optimization model to improve the productivity of energy systems, case study: Solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: Furthermore, SOFC optimum operating conditions as a function of target lifetime are derived.
Titulo: Degradation based operational optimization model to improve the productivity of energy systems, case study: Solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: To show the effectiveness of the developed framework, model outputs are compared with two other operating strategies; a base case strategy that optimizes system operating conditions without considering degradation mechanisms and a strategy based on Department of Energy's (DOE) 2016 fuel cell report.
Titulo: Degradation based operational optimization model to improve the productivity of energy systems, case study: Solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: Results illustrated that degradation based optimization is more beneficial for improving the entire performance in long-term operation:For instance, system productivity is 7.4% higher in comparison with DOE strategy during 40,000 h operating lifetime.
Titulo: Degradation based operational optimization model to improve the productivity of energy systems, case study: Solid oxide fuel cell stacks

Sentencas: It is expected that the proposed methodology will lead to more rapid commercialization of SOFC technology.
Titulo: Degradation based operational optimization model to improve the productivity of energy systems, case study: Solid oxide fuel cell stacks
